body:
There have been people that have responded to this issue and supported this proposal saying that this problem applies to them. It seems _their_ responses have been elided. If they are to be addressed it does seem like a counter-proposal is necessary. So far the package-alias seems to be one but it only applies if you want to move an entire package, so it doesn't seem very useful.

SemVer is a useful tool and quite necessary where it applies. It clearly doesn't apply here. If you use package A that uses L1 and package B that uses L2 you can't pass around L1.T or L2.T to both A and B.
If L2.T was an alias to L1.T you could (provided just L2.T was backwards compatible with L1.T, not at all far-fetched, as was pointed out).
